reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - warm and welcoming
reviews.text: We stayed the day after Labor Day for one night. I booked a suite for the last night of our trip and I wasn't disappointed with the facilities.

On arrival we used the valet parking ($29 which compared to London prices is a bargain) - the guys were very helpful and also helped sort out our bags. Reception staff were equally welcoming - they explained all of the facilities on offer - restaurants, bars, spa etc., and checked us in with speed and courtesy. We got to our suite and they then called us 15 mins later to make sure everything was to our satisfaction.
reviews.title: Classy hotel, fabulous service!

reviews.text: The suite was huge and covered two rooms via an interconnecting door. There was a bathroom in the king sized bedroom and another off the suite area. There was also a small kitchen. The shower in the bathroom had great water pressure and the towels were thick and fluffy - I really liked the Spa shower gel and shampoo. The bed linen was high quality and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel Experience

likes.liked: — Everything; New Brunswick is a great city and place to stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: It was a shame we could only stay one night as it didn't give us a chance to use the spa but it looked very stylish. I would happily stay at the Heldrich again - it was central to New Brunswick near theatres and restaurants and was quiet and stylish - we had a great last evening in NJ here and we slept very well.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: The suite was an indulgence and I would probably book a standard room if I stayed again but at $349 we both thought it represented great value (particularly when you compare it to hotel prices in NYC)
reviews.title: Beautiful but not flawless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is fabulous! My husband and I stayed here recently and the property is spotless, the service wonderful and the location excellent (lots of bars and restaurants nearby, and close to public transporation, i.e., New Jersey Transit train to take you directly into NYC in about an hour). We even got a free upgrade to a king bed without even asking. If I stay in the area again, I would definitely stay here - it was perfect.
reviews.title: Loved the Heldrich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a Diamond in the Rough! At first my boyfirend and I were a little concerned about the location (downtown New Brunswick), but it definitely had its perks! It was right across from the State Theater, so we were planning a date night of "dinner and a show," but we also found out from the conceierge, that a comedy club (The Stress Factory) was just a few blocks away, and well within walking distance. Plus, since my sweetie and I are foodies, there were TONS of places to choose from! Everything from upscale to more casual dining. Plus, since it's a college town with Rutgers close by, you know that there are definitely afforable eateries. So, yeah overall it was definitely a nice little getaway for THIS happy couple. Especially with the couples spa package. We plan on going back for our anniversary the end of the month. ;O)
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.text: Room Service is impossible. Many members of staff cannot speak the King's English. The neighborhood is shabby and parking is impossible. Great emphasis is placed on valet parking, but the parking staff is so busy playing video games that you wait...and wait...and wait.

reviews.title: Staff that bent over backwards to please

reviews.text: The Heldrich is a superb addition to downtown New Brunswick. We recently stayed there for a family wedding and were very pleased. The rooms were clean, modern, very comfortable beds. Friendly staff, convenient location, would highly recommend. The catering for the wedding reception was spectacular with top notch food and service.
reviews.title: Nice New Hotel in New Brunswick

reviews.text: We stayed at the Heldrich for one night in December. Our room was an average sized hotel room and came with everything we needed (full ironing board, plenty of storage space). It is located in the center of New Brunswick, across the street from the State Theater and many restaurants. The staff was very friendly, the room was extremely clean and the king sized bed was very comfortable. Best hotel for someone seeing a show at the State Theater since you can just walk across the street. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Heldrich

reviews.text: I stayed at the Heldrich for one night in December of 2007 for business. Overall there were some problems with my stay but the staff helped to remedy the situation somewhat.

reviews.text: I was very pleased upon arrival at this hotel. It was modern and very clean. Everything was new and professionally decorated. The restaurant was fabulous. The room was large and super clean. The bed was very luxurious. The carpet was upgraded. This is one of my favorite hotels. The location is prime. It is extremely comfortable but the parking is obnoxiously priced. I would never pay for the hotel to valet my car. If the valet parking were reasonably priced, then this hotel would be nearly perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanted to do a quick Saturday night getaway with my girlfriend. Booked room off of hotels.com as their price was less than all other websites, plus a free split of champagne was included. Requested a King room. Arrived in New Brunswick and wasn’t going to pay $32 for valet parking. A public parking garage is less than half a block away and it was $5 for the night. Problems started at check in. Front desk staff was nice enough, but I requested a King bed when I put in the reservation and was told that they are 100% booked and only had 2 doubles. This isn’t very romantic but he said there is nothing he could do. You would figure that they would block off king rooms for a champagne "special". I stated that hotels.com shouldn’t have said that there was king bed availability when there wasn’t. He kept stating nothing he could do. Had to ask about when the champagne was going to be delivered, he said "oh, Ill send it up in 5 or 10 minutes". I would guarantee if I didn’t say something it would have been forgotten. Room was very modern and clean. Well appointed with very comfortable beds and crisp linens, a small desk and sofa chair. Large armoire with ample hangers and drawers with a TV in the middle. Room overlooked the state theater entrance. Couldn’t really hear traffic or street noise at all. Bathroom was decent with nice amenities and high shower head. The hotel is basically brand new (opened March 2007) and you could tell. They have a neat documentary on the building of the hotel on the hotel TV channel. Back to the champagne... 5 or 10 minutes turned into 30 minutes so I called down to the front desk and asked him where it was. They apologized and said it would be right up. About 5 minutes later it was, and it was tasty (Taittinger Brut, actually a decent Champagne). The property is centrally located and within walking distance of many restaurants and 3 theaters are right across the street. We ate at Spuntino 360 and it was VERY good.
reviews.title: Very nice room, not so good service
